item.description:
SCIENCE ON SCREEN is back!

They are starting the season with silent films supported by live music.  For "Science is Fiction" they have posted:  "The mesmerizing, utterly unclassifiable short science films of Jean Painlevé (1902-89) have to be seen to be believed: delightful, surrealist-influenced dream works that are also serious science. The French filmmaker-scientist-inventor had a decades-spanning career in which he created hundreds of short films on subjects ranging from astronomy to pigeons to, most famously, such marine-life marvels as the sea horse and the sea urchin.   With live musical accompaniment by Dr. Caterwaul's Cadre of Clairvoyant Claptraps."

 

Website for this event:   http://www.realartways.org/cinema.htm#painleve

Admission:
Real Art Ways Members: $5 (the same price since 1996!)
Seniors & Students Members: $4.50
Regular Admission (non-members): $10
Seniors (62+) / Students (full-time with ID): $7

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Science on Screen: "Science is Fiction" @ RAW
